course.subject: MGMT
course.name: Strategic Management in China
course.description: The overall goal of this course is to teach the students key theories and frameworks in strategic management and apply them to Chinese context.  it takes a comparative perspective to analyze the similarities and differences in strategic management between East and West.  It is case intensive course which involves extensive student participation in analyzing cases of business in China.

reviews.author: bigboy777
reviews.comment_content: just very generic overview of doing business in china. mostly using case studies. no quantitative materials at all. not so sure why this is a 4000 level course, should be 2000.
reviews.comment_teaching: i think it could be better. mostly just going through pretty basic concepts and discussion. she gives you participation cards and bc of this, ppl say random stuff that isn't really meaningful.
reviews.comment_grading: her grading is pretty generous, but i feel like she prefers generic answers rather than those that are more in-depth. those that took IB should watch out because that's not she wants.
reviews.comment_workload: i'd say the presentation takes quite a lot of work, esp if you are in a group with not so motivated students. you have to read case every week and take quiz (make sure do well because they actually make a difference in the final letter grade...)

reviews.author: youwillbefine
reviews.title: hard works paid off !!
reviews.comment_content: introducing the china business environment and how to do business in china
reviews.comment_teaching: very informative that she talks a lot with company examples! easy to understand ~! and her english is good so no worries~!! and she is willing to have consultations on group projects and gives advices!!
reviews.comment_grading:
very generous!!
my grade:
project (25%): 23.75/30
peer evaluation (10%) : unknown
2 mini write up (20%): 20/20
9 MCs quizzes (10%) : 45/46
essay critique (25%) : 21/25
not compulsory bonus essay: 2.8/3
attendance + parti (10%): unknown but never skipped class and tried to answer once every lesson (ps. skip class need to do make up essay><)
overall A+!!
reviews.comment_workload: really need to read long cases every week for the weekly MC quiz and try to answer her questions during class! overall workload is okay

reviews.author: little ass
reviews.title: good grade if you make effort
reviews.comment_teaching: prof bilian is very knowledgable and likeable, but overruns a lot when the class was already 3 hours long
reviews.comment_grading:
need to be active in class if you want an a, the mean is super high
group project 25% (23.2, 0.5 sd higher) + peer evaluation 10% (unknown, 1 sd higher)
parti 10% (full)
quizzes on case 10% (9 of them, 5 mc in each) (got 2 q wrong)
2 short essays 20% (19.5, 0.5 sd higher)
final essay 25% (21.3, 1.3 sd higher)
bonus work (2.3 out of 3)
overall a
for project, start early, consult her more and earlier to show effort and check if she agrees with your ideas so you can make changes earlier
for essay, i advice reference more from readings, cases and lecture notes
reviews.comment_workload:
cant really skip class
one compulsory ~15 pages case on a chinese company per week, could be dreadful if you dont like to read
no exams, two 2 pages double spaced essay and one 5 pages double spaced essay
the project is a bit time consuming in terms of discussion, but ppt and present is alright cuz the team has 7 ppl
i also did the bonus assignment which was a 2 pages essay

reviews.author: unspecified
reviews.title: Decent
reviews.comment_content: Pretty interesting content that has quite relevant to how business in China operates. If you're willing to put in the effort, you will definitely come out with 'practical' business knowledge -- this is not at all a theory-based class.
reviews.comment_teaching: Bilian is a good prof, but at times her accent can make it a tiny bit confusing to understand. Also, the classes are three hours long, so unfortunately towards the end it does end up being too informative all at once.
reviews.comment_grading: Bilian grades generously and gives good advice, but her attendance policy is a bit ridiculous. If you're planning to skip class at all, stay away from this course.
reviews.comment_workload: Decent workload, no finals or midterms which is nice but the readings and case studies make up for it.

reviews.author: bpw
reviews.title: Very Informative
reviews.comment_content: There will be assigned reading each week and during the lesson, the professor will talk about some frameworks and practical information first and then there will be a discussion on the company featured in the weekly reading.
reviews.comment_teaching: I like the way the professor delivered the content as she did not just talk about the theories but actually let us discussed and came up with our own solutions before telling us what she thinks about the case. And Professor Sullivan was a very nice teacher.
reviews.comment_grading: If you are willing to learn and try your best to complete every task, you will probably get a fair grade.
reviews.comment_workload: We have got no examination but 2 write-ups and 1 final paper to submit. Also, there will be weekly reading and discussion for every lesson.

reviews.author: hw5010
reviews.comment_content:
Cover basic business environment in China
No textbook, but you need to read 1 case study and 1 readying every week before attending class
Though it sounds a lot, but the content of the readings and case studies are well-linked to the content of the lecture, easy to follow
Readings and Case Studies are quite out-of-date, but prof always provide latest update of the respective issues mentioned in the cases
There is a quiz at the beginning of every lecture, pretty easy (just MC), just to check if you have read the case study or not
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Sullivan is a very experienced professor, very nice and encourage in class interaction with students.

Lecture split into 2 parts, (1) lecture and (2) case discussion
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is pretty fair.
Participation(10%): attendance is counted, you are required to attend every lecture, if you are absent, you need to write a make-up essay in regard of the case studies of that lecture
Quiz(10%): 1 quiz per lecture, to test whether you have read the case study or not (pretty easy, just MC / yes or no question)
2 Assignments(20%): Among all the readings, you have to choose 2 and write an essay (2 page max) in regard to the reading materials
Group Project(35%): 1 project presentation, basically focus on strategic management issues of Chinese/ International enterprise
One individual Essay(25%): Write an essay with a given topic, make sure to integrate concepts and ideas from class and reading materials
No Midterms and Finals
reviews.comment_workload:
Like a normal MGMT course: LOTS OF READINGS
but the quizzes will "motivate" you to read all the materials on time
Assignments are pretty easy, just share one existing enterprise that is adopting the concepts mentioned in the assigned reading
Group Project: if you are assigned with in international enterprise (like Apple), you can finish your project mostly by googling everything that you need, but if you are assigned with an Chinese enterprise, you might need to put more and more effort as those assigned Chinese enterprise usually don't have sufficient information and articles online.

reviews.author: Kevin CUI
reviews.comment_content: Most of the content is common sense. The content of the course may highly depend on the professor. Sam's MGMT 4220 is a kind of waste.
reviews.comment_teaching: Sam is not good at teching at all, that is all my classmates comment. There is no logic between courses.
reviews.comment_grading: I think the grading is quite fair even I only got C, because I was not doing good on presentation.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is light, including presentation, group project, project proposal. It is important to find good team members as the group project accounts for a relatively large proportion of the grade.
